A total solar eclipse will occur in Salem.The shadow first touches land near Newport, Oregon at 17:15:50.6UT (at about 10:15 in the morning) on August 21, 2017 and lasts a full minute and fifty seconds of totality.Within two minutes the shadow extends eastward toward Dallas, Albany, Corvallis, Lebanon, Philomath, McMinnville, Woodburn, and Salem. The length of totality will vary based on distances from the centerline. On the steps of the State Capitol in Salem (the first of five state capitals the shadow will visit), lucky viewers will be treated to 1m54.5s of shadow at just after 10:17am.
www.eclipse2017.org/2017/communities/states/OR/Salem_1357.htm

column5: James B. Thompson: Fragments In Time
column15:
James B. Thompson, an art faculty member at Willamette University, teaches painting, drawing and printmaking. The exhibition features Thompson's work over the past twenty years, from his Medieval and Golf Series of the 1990s and early 2000s, to his most recent work that includes glass created at Bullseye Glass in Portland. Hours: Tues.-Sat. 10 a.m.-5 p.m.; Sun. 1-5 p.m.; closed Mondays.General admission $6; Senior 55+ $3; Students 18+ w/ ID $3; Youth 17 & under free; Tuesday free for everyone.

Salem, OR 97301

column5: A Drone's Eye View: What a Flying Camera Sees and Does
column15:
